website_summaries.verdict: A little too large for some mini-ITX builders, but that allows for a few larger components. Trades some sturdiness for lighter weight.
pros: Good interior configuration, even if it is on the small side
Removable drive cages allow for larger components
Lightweight enough to carry with one hand, even with components installed
No vibration when fans are running
cons: Handgrip hoops on top of case are pretty flimsy
Overheating is an issue when larger graphics cards are installed

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but definitely needed refinement.
customer_reviews.text: I like the layout of this case, however, the PSU cage at the bottom has a difficult time fitting its cabling around the hard disk cage at the bottom. Additionally, the front of the case does not allow decent air flow through the case, and if one uses the extra hard disk cage at the top, it makes matters worse for air flow through the case. Choosing to put the power switches on the side of the case makes the case even more difficult to work as one has to be careful these connectors do not pull the wires from the mainboard noting it may be necessary to remove that panel to work in the chassis.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch Hasues

customer_reviews.title: Great, stylish case for small form factor build
customer_reviews.text: Love this case, built a gamer for my son in it with a small tower CPU cooler and a mini ITX GTX 1070 GPU. Because of the style, and having an optical drive bay, it's not nearly as compact as others I've seen. I have done an ITX build before in a case that's about the size of a Skechers shoe box. The front fan slot allows for great airflow with a large 200mm fan and it's fairly easy to do a build in. My main recommendation for novice builders is to get as many motherboard connections done as possible before securing it to the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Kentros

customer_reviews.title: A lotta look, not so much fun inside.
customer_reviews.text: A little too flimsy to be comfortable carrying, but a different (good) look, classic, but it IS small. You have to really be meticulous about placement of anything, and there's very little space for the atx psu. Not easy cable management. It's better looking than it is easy to work with, but the outside means a lot to a lot of my clients. I build computers for a living, so my bias may be showing through. I could get one of my guys to laser cut the logo, put some 3M tape on it and charge $30 more than I think it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Great case, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great case, but a few tidbits to be aware of before buying: -the front comes loaded with a 120mm fan instead of a big 230mm fan. (the 230's are pretty loud though) -both provided fans are 3pin 120mm, and decent. -the front & top can both accomodate 240mm radiators - if you use the cd bay though, they both become 120mm -the doors of the case can be difficult to open/close (on a per-unit basis) -no "real" dust filters across the huge grills on top & bottom.
customer_reviews.author: sturdy55

customer_reviews.title: Great Case that is far more capable than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Freaking great case, well designed. Ive built a High end gaming rig, in this small case, its light surprisingly sturdy even without the drive cages, i have 3 SSDs and a 3.5 HHD, and a Blu-ray Optical drive in the system, along with a GTX 1080. it even has room for smaller AIO closed loop water , if you took out the optical drive you could probably have water cooling for both the GPU and CPU. its an awesome and good looking case that is quite portable. if you are looking for a Mini ITX case this is the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Justin N. Constantino

customer_reviews.title: The box is larger than advertised.
customer_reviews.text: The "handles" feel weak. Just wanted to get that out of the way before I get into the crux of the issue: This box is way larger than advertised, which is inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya Biznes

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I built it a couple of weeks ago, so far so good. It looks great! but... T The handles feel like they can barely support the weight once you fill it up with your PC guts. (although they have so far) The work area for putting it together was really cramped, but I expected this for an ITX build. It's bigger than I expected, but that's mostly my fault for not using a tapemeasure when reading the specs. The side panels are a bit loose, if you tap them they make a clanking noise. I thought the fans might make the side panels vibrate and constantly make horrible metal clanking noises. Fortunately they didn't. Nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, one bad rivet, sharp handles. Still love it.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I didn't give this 5 stars is because a rivet missed the motherboard mount, so it was crooked. I only found this out after mounting everything in the case and it wouldn't line up. I didn't want to send it back, so I drilled through the rivet and used a screw, all better. The other issue is, I bought this to make a hackintosh instead of buying a Mac trash can. My plan was, and is, to haul it around. But be warned the edges on the handles are VERY sharp. I ended up buying a little dolly, which worsk.
customer_reviews.author: friskevision

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this case if you on plan on building a ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case to replace the Corsair Obsidian 250D. This case is so much easier to build in and I was able to fit a tall heatsink and fan in the case without a problem. Cable management was definitely easier than the previous case. I would definitely recommend this case if you on plan on building a mini ITX build. My only con would be the bright blue lights on the side of the case. My mobo has an option to disable the LED in good night mode, however you can also disconnect the wiring to the lights to solve the problem as well.
customer_reviews.author: K Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: it looks nice in pictures tho
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent case but nothing spectacular. The bottom and top handles are flimsy, I thought they would be solid plastic. The interior layout works well, the cable is scrunched up on the side in my build but everything fits. It is larger than it looks. For my next case I will look for something smaller. This one was in between sizes and quality. Don't know if the bottom and top handles are really necessary, it looks nice in pictures tho.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Spacious ITX case
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ITX case. The inside leaves a lot of room to work with and has a lot of bays for additional hard drives. I use mine as a NAS box and easily fit four hard drives inside with no problem. There is also ample extra room for 2.5 inch drives in the side panel. Install was a breeze. My only complaint is that the top plastic fins feel a little cheap, but that's a cosmetic thing really. It's still not enough to deduct a full star for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Review Dude

customer_reviews.title: A great compact well built versatile case
customer_reviews.text: At first I wondered if this case would be too compact but after packing in the Gigabyte Z87 Mini-ITX motherboard, and the Corsair H80i liquid CPU cooler H80i, i was pleasantly surprised to see everything fit quite well. The CPU cooler did require removal of a rear case fan, (it has two of its own) however you can relocate that elsewhere if needed. Just be aware that some larger power supplies might be tight but I used a Corsair HX650 and it fit fine. I topped it off with a full length GTX770 graphics cards fit. All of this full size gear still left room for an optical drive and two hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hall

customer_reviews.title: Wicked Build Quality ...except for the handles/legs.
customer_reviews.text: This case has been awesome for me so far. It is really customizable and every feature you'd want is there. You can definitely max out a mini-ITX build in this thing! The metal is way thicker and more solid than comparable cases at this price. The rubberized coating and fan filters make the case seem super premium ...that is until you get to the handles/legs. They are a very thin plastic and flex/wobble all over the place. It just seems like that one design oversight that made a premium product sub-par. If the top and bottom panels were the same metal this would get 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Untch

customer_reviews.title: Sexy box!
customer_reviews.text: If your computer components are stuck living in the projects with the other section 8 components, get them an extreme home makeover with this Bill Gates status mansion. You have to get that smaller motherboard, and a gfx card that fits obv, but I can't image a tiny pleasure machine ever looking soooo good. I made a hackintosh mac pro, but I don't use it much anymore. I've moved on.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Goldfinger

customer_reviews.title: I really like this case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. I was able to install a full size GTX 780 graphics card in this case and it provides plenty of ventilation for all the other components. Only thing that could be better is access for power supply cables. The PSU I used was probably just too large and I had a difficult time cramming it into the space provided as the cables couldn't turn the corner sharply enough.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua K.

customer_reviews.title: which is nice, and everything lines up as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The case legs are extremely flimsy and prone to stress breakage, even without extra weight. Five of eight clips holding the case legs in place were fractured, three on the bottom and one on the top. The case is generally spacious on the interior, which is nice, and everything lines up as advertised. A modular PSU is a must with this case.
customer_reviews.author: Steve G.

customer_reviews.title: Great little game box with style.
customer_reviews.text: The case had plenty of room for a Gigabyte GTX 1060 video card but had to remove the upper drive bays. It was simple as they were held in place with lever action clips. (They planned ahead!). Good ventilation and room for 2 or 3 hard drives even with the upper cages removed. Only downside is that it was a little expensive but if you want the look, you have to pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E Holman

customer_reviews.title: Love this case
customer_reviews.text: Micro ATX case with window. I love this case. Built a nice portable VR/gaming rig. Very easy to carry one handed. All components fit you just have to plan it out. Once everything is in not a lot of room to move cables around.
customer_reviews.author: mark day

customer_reviews.title: Quality Mini-ITX Case!
customer_reviews.text: This high-quality case is well thought-out and worked well for my minimal mini-itx build. I appreciate the modularity of it; despite the small size, there are a lot of options for how to mount drives and fans. My case came with the bottom arm cracked. When I wrote to Bitfenix about this, they very promptly sent me a replacement, so props to their excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gerner

customer_reviews.title: Cool looking, Medium Sized
customer_reviews.text: I like the modern look, reminds me of the Mac towers. I like the medium height--perfect to avoid getting knocked over or taking up space. Created a awesome rig with this.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Best case I have owned
customer_reviews.text: While it is a Mini-ITX case, mine has turned out pretty sweet. The only downside that I could find was that there was no cover for the power supply sides. While some people love to display the stickers on their prized power supply because they over paid for a brand name when they should have invested in more RAM, an SSD, better CPU or just about anything on a PC other than a power supply, I do not care and ended up cutting a piece of Plexiglas and painting it white in order to cover this opening.
customer_reviews.author: TangoTech

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Pretty Case & Fragile
customer_reviews.text: This case looks good and is compact. I squeezed everything I needed into this baby. The only problem is the handles which are made of plastic, making them feel fragile and flimsy. Update After 3 Years: A plastic handle has broken off, a small crack formed on one of the feet and it just snapped off. The most fragile part of the case is plastic and it doesnt make sense. Also the size of the case does not allow for large graphics cards so you need to keep this in mind.
customer_reviews.author: BigRed

customer_reviews.title: small, but great features.
customer_reviews.text: great case, great price. the "legs" and "handles" on bottom, and top of the case are plastic, and a bit bouncy (seems like the only negative aspect of it). The inside of the case seems very well made, and the build was very easy. had plenty of space for 2 "3 1/2" drives, optical drive, and 2 SSDs, in addition to a single fan water cooler, and a large graphics card. Definitely would recommend it,
customer_reviews.author: bigcuce

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Here is my prediction of your reaction to this case: 1. (taking it out of the box) wow, that is bigger than I thought it would be. 2. (after a few minutes of checking it out) it actually isn't all that big, and it is really cool looking. 3. (case open, thinking about how you will build it) wow, there are a lot of ways I can go here... 4. (during and after you build it) This case is Awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Happy in Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Front panel USBs did not work initially, but we ...
customer_reviews.text: Front panel USBs did not work initially, but we were able to get a replacement case with no hassle. Internals of the case are a bit tight, but if you're careful with your cables, there isn't too much trouble setting everything up. The biggest issue I had was connecting the graphics card power cables due to the optical drive nearly blocking the ports.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: The best mini-ITX case under $150
customer_reviews.text: This is perhaps the best iteration of the mini-ITX form factor - not only does it provide an excellent amount of space for larger video cards and closed-loop cooling, it has great airflow and looks fantastic. Given that you can take out HDD drive bays allows you to really expand the amount of workable space that you have, and the areas in which you can place SSD's are such so that they will be out of the way (in the right case panel).
customer_reviews.author: thomas park

customer_reviews.title: Everything is awesome about this case
customer_reviews.text: Everything is awesome about this case. Subtracted one start for a stripped screw on the 3.5inch front bay. Took some pliers, force, and bending to remove it. Handles are also a bit flimsy. After a complete build, I would not recommend carrying the case by the handles. Other than that, awesome case, lots of room, sleek looks and not too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: LtRoyalShrimp

customer_reviews.title: Good Mini-ITX case with some tradeoffs
customer_reviews.text: This case looks awesome, but the handles are made of flexible plastic, so it's a little unstable. Comes with two large case fans, so you'll likely need a power splitter. Most mini-ITX boards I've seen don't have multiple headers for case fans. There's room for tons of drives or coolers. Longer video cards will interfere​ with the drive bay sleds, but the housing can be turned around for access from the other side.
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Love the inside but the feet and top are way to weak.
customer_reviews.text: Inside of this case is awesome lots of drive options. Its fairly small. Lots of Fan options. But the feet are so flimsy that when you get all of your gear into the case, the case actually rocks back and forth on the feet if bumped. Im acutally considering removing the bottem "feet" and replaciing with something a little stronger. Or removing them all together and just propping it up off of its bottom somehow.
customer_reviews.author: J-Rod1983

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: Great case! I watched a video review on youtube and instantly liked this case for a Hackintosh build. It hides well behind my 22inch monitor.
customer_reviews.author: gotacube

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good case but becareful when u hold the plastic handle to carry sharp on edges
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: I love this case... it ROCKS!
customer_reviews.text: Measure your power supply carefully. I really like the power supply that I purchased for this system build- but- it is just a fraction longer than I thought it would be and I was forced to come up with some genius manipulations to make it fit in this case. There is otherwise plenty of room in this case for a mini ITX. Don't listen to the haters. This case is plenty durable. It is also fun, quiet, stylish and affordable. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Missylis

customer_reviews.title: high quality, cool lookin'
customer_reviews.text: I'm super happy with this case, good looking and high quality, absolutely worth paying a little more for a higher quality product. pros: this case has a ton of configuration possibilities, plenty of room for even large video cards. no tools needed to install almost everything. the metal on this case is the thickest I've seen on any case I've used making this case a tank. cons: none, but if i had to be picky the BitFenix logo was glued on a little cockeyed, not bad, just enough to bug me.
customer_reviews.author: D0G HAIR

customer_reviews.title: and I really like it. I wish there were an option to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first ITX case I've used, and I really like it. I wish there were an option to get a front panel without an optical port, and I ended up pulling out three drive cages that I'll probably never use so it would have been nice if they were optional also. Build quality is quite good, though the plastic "handles" do flex a bit, even if a mostly empty case.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P. Kalafarski

customer_reviews.title: Good looking but poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Case looks good, but the micro itx MB I bought,places the SATA ports pointing right at the upper HDD cage. Also, the attractive loop legs and handles are very flimsy plastic
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: amazing case with looks to match its function.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build in, pretty to look at, and all in all one of the best cases in this form factor that I have ever seen. if you want to make a mini itx rig then look no further. Its nice to be at a LAN and see a bunch of my friends with their 'gamer'-y looking cases that are all big and black and then to just have my subtle little chalk white prodigy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mini-ITX case
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case for its size, fits everything I need it to and more. Minus 1 star because mine arrived damaged. There are no signs of damage on the cardboard box or any of the packaging and it was completely sealed up. The threads where one of the thumb screws for the side panel goes was bent pretty bad. It doesn't really effect anything, but it would be nice to be able to use both thumbscrews to secure the panel.
customer_reviews.author: ScottyD

customer_reviews.title: The Computer Saving Case
customer_reviews.text: This case saved the internals of the computer I built about a year ago when my desk broke unexpectedly. The flexible handle on the top absorbed most of the shock and the computer was fine. Though the handle broke I am very happy with this case. It has plenty of air flow and with a full sized modular PSU I was still able to fit in two 3.5in hard drives.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room for a small case. All my parts fit easily and on the first try. It's very quiet, and I even used the handles a lot when I was looking for a place to put it. If there were to be a gripe it'd be that it's kinda big for a mini-ITX case, and maybe it's a little pricey compared to some other mini-ITX cases that aren't as good-looking. But in the end, it looks great and works great and that's what matters to me.
customer_reviews.author: Fieryermine

customer_reviews.title: One of the best small cases on the market!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case, it's small size is perfect. You can put it on top of a desk or under it without any issues. The color options are very cool as well. The handles make it easy to move around if you have to. The power and reset cables are grouped together nicely as well. Overall a great PC case!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little design
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this case for a few months and really like it. I fit a GTX 770 in there without any issues, thanks to the removable drive cages. The finishes are all quite nice and while it's a bit pricier than most mini-itx cases, I think there's good value there. The HDD access led is very bright and distracting, I'll probably end up disconnecting it the next time I have the case open. No complaints beyond that though, I'll definitely be keeping an eye on future models from BitFenix based on a positive experience with this model.
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: ... this case as a first time builder and I love it. Really easy cable management and workspace
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case as a first time builder and I love it. Really easy cable management and workspace. I love the mini-itx form factor and the handles on it are great for lugging it around. Some people say they are flimsy and fear they might give but I don't share this concern. Granted my internals aren't tricked out at all. Pretty barebones inside with the mobo, graphics card, power supply, single solid state drive, and a corsair h100i cooler. The only thing I wish it came with was a windowed side panel but you can't always get what you want :)
customer_reviews.author: William G.

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but it's not so "mini"
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this case, it's slick looking, have space for everything, super easy to install! You might have to buy a few fan power splitters because this case got room for so many fans while mini-itx motherboard normally only come with 2 plugs (one for the CPU that leave only 1 more for the fan). Either way i'm in love with it, my only complain is that it's a lot fatter than other micro ITX cases.
customer_reviews.author: ThaoThao

customer_reviews.title: Kinda flimsy but it does its job
customer_reviews.text: The handles/feet feel very flimsy. I haven't broken them yet, but I feel like I'm going to every time I have to move it. I was honestly expecting them to be a lot tougher. The over all quality of materials seems a little poor, but it does a great job holding my NAS. Easy to install and generally not a bad case.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case, and room for a bunch of hard drives.
customer_reviews.text: The cased are great, well made. Knocked off a star because the plastic handles and feet They need to make these cases without those
customer_reviews.author: baloo584

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini-ITX case
customer_reviews.text: Completed my first build with this case a few months ago. I couldn't have chosen a better case. Its compact and easy to carry around and yet it can hold a lot of components. I was able to squeeze a full size graphic card, an aftermarket CPU cooler, 2 drives, and more with room to spare. The build quality is great-- I carry this thing around quite often and it doesn't even look worn. There's plenty of airflow in the case as well. My only gripe is that the power switch/lights are affixed to the side panel, but other than that its an awesome case.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: White Lightning
customer_reviews.text: I'll start with the bad. Mine came with one of the screws for the 5.25" ODD bay striped out. I had to get out the power drill and drill it out. Other than that, this case is clean, tidy, and designed to hold a lot of high end hardware in a small space.
customer_reviews.author: StrifeWolfe

customer_reviews.title: but nothing of great concern. Near little case
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit wobbly, but nothing of great concern. Near little case, but not enough cable management. It's actually quite large. I have a ton of space in there that I'll never use. But it looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Simon Nim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the Bitfenix Prodigy Mini-ITX computer case. It offers amazing versatility and is very customizable. But Bitfenix didn't sacrifice looks and aesthetics for usability. The case looks great! This is my personal favorite computer case and would definitely reccomend it to first-timers and experienced PC alike.
customer_reviews.author: ricq

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case. Very intuitive, I had my PC together and installing Windows in less than 30 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby R.

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price
customer_reviews.text: It has lots of room along with the ability to use or leave out the hard disk cages. Access is easy and extra long cables can be hidden away. It is bigger than a typical mITX case, closer to mATX size. Its construction is solid, there is no flimsiness at all. If it included the optional mesh front it would be an exceptional case
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Great case! Super roomy compared to most mini-ITX cases ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case! Super roomy compared to most mini-ITX cases allowing for large heatsink and excellent hard drive flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: D_J

customer_reviews.title: You'll probably be better served by a normal mid-tower
customer_reviews.text: This case is a LOT larger than it looks in pictures. You'll probably be better served by a normal mid-tower. That said, it's a joy to work inside of this thing, no cramping, easy cable routing, really good 2.5" drive mount on the right-side door.
customer_reviews.author: BOX

customer_reviews.title: A beautifully designed case
customer_reviews.text: A beautifully designed case - with only one flaw. The design of the case looks great - and functions well. The only complaint that I have is that cooling options could be better - as it is such a small space, things do tend to get pretty warm inside of it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case, fair price. Was a bit disappointed with the top arches being made out of plastic. I wouldn't carry this around by the top handles. I wish they would of used metal.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent computer case. The bottom supports are rather more wobbly than I expected, and the fans are not variable speed, but the latter can easily be replaced if necessary. The case is well laid out and air flow is excellent. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: G. Vigers

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, but your rig will be tight inside.
customer_reviews.text: Quality case, nice features and styling/look, but was a bit too small for my personal preference. Returned it, and the ITX board in favor of full size rig. It could not accommodate the water cooler without installing part of it outside the case.
customer_reviews.author: A M

customer_reviews.title: I really like this case
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case, but I wish there was a way to remove or replace the curved feet. While I appreciate the dampening function they serve, they result in my computer rocking back and forth every time I plug/unplug a headset or usb cable. It is very annoying. Other than this, I have no issues with this case.
customer_reviews.author: joe c

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, slim case
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome case! The color is as eye-popping as you would expect and the size of the whole thing is minuscule! A few concerns: the handles are plastic (as opposed to the rest of the body which is metal) and thus feel a little fragile. Also, (as expected for a mini-ITX) cable management was tricky but not impossible. All in all, I would recommend this case for anyone attempting an HTPC/Steambox build or even just looking for a smaller desktop case.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Giessner

customer_reviews.title: Terrible buy for the price and damages easily
customer_reviews.text: After owning this for 2 years I'm gonna finally do a review on it. Terrible buy for the price and damages easily. I think their cases are to overpriced compared to what you can get these days.
customer_reviews.author: B.Prasavanh

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Like open space cases so I modded mine. I posted a pick of it. The only problem is the handles and legs are a bit under built but they hold together
customer_reviews.author: Lisa F.

customer_reviews.title: Easily fixed as I had black (matches case color) mix ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a Prodigy, what else is there to say? Cons: Handles screwed portion both upper and lower right side were cracked/chipped/broken total of 4/8 positions as well as one of the hinges of the upper handle. How did this happen? No clue. My guess, handling or QC problem. Easily fixed as I had black (matches case color) mix super glue at hand which sorted it out without problems even while carrying it by one handle with the entire rig internals weighing it down.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Great to work in but arrived damage -probably shipping issue-
customer_reviews.text: I love working in this case but unfortunately due to shipping it came slightly damages but was easy to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Lucien

customer_reviews.title: It's a good case. Really nice looking
customer_reviews.text: It's a good case. Really nice looking. BUT I would tell everyone to get the micro atx version because that version has better upgradeability because of a larger motherboard. This one only uses a micro atx one and leaves a lot of open air. Still a nice case though!
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo S.

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I used this case as my NAS. Not only did it offer great HDD capacity ( 6 with my configuration ) but it has a great number of cooling options as well. The case will support a 230mm front fan, 140mm rear fan, and 2: 120mm top fans. I would recommend this case to anyone. It is a small enough form factor to be hidden (if desired), while still offering multiple options for your needs
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great Mini ITX casing
customer_reviews.text: perfect for mini itx and a lot of room for expansion and additional accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow. 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive, great airflow, and liquid cooling compatible. 10/10. One of the best Mini- ITX cases on the market. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SatRex

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous case, though the top and bottom "handles" feel ...
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous case, though the top and bottom "handles" feel as if I could break them by lifting them too hard. They are removable, but part of the case, regardless.
customer_reviews.author: AϾ

customer_reviews.title: Attractive enough, with a few design flaws
customer_reviews.text: Pros: attractive sturdy spacious (Everything I wanted to fit in it, actually fit) cons: Front panel is solid, even though there is a fan mounted behind it?????why??? -1 fan that comes with it sucks
customer_reviews.author: Soul

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: Great case easy to work with inside can be hard to get your hand in to to get everything fitted but this is a ITX case so that is to be expected. Only thing I did not really like is how easy it was to damage the window that came with the case but I replaced mine with a custom one so that was no big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow, easy to build in
customer_reviews.text: Great airflow, easy to build in, love the aesthetics (though I wish the colored versions also had mesh fronts or mesh front options for airflow). Best case I've ever had, and that's saying a lot (250D, HAF XB EVO, Prodigy, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Case With Great Features
customer_reviews.text: I already own the Orange version of this case for myself. I picked this up for my kids. If you're looking for a great case for a MIni-ITX build, this is the one that you want.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case
customer_reviews.text: Great case Has ample room for all of your drives...you can even mount 5 2.5 inch drives outside of the 3.5 inch cage provided. I am using this as an HTPC case and it works very well. The only con is the handle and legs seem a bit weak to me...they work but wish they were a bit stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: ITGuru

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact case
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good airflow Modular Very clean design Sturdy construction Decent quality fans
customer_reviews.author: Riley K

customer_reviews.title: Best Mini-ITX Desktop Case
customer_reviews.text: Much needs not be said about the tried and tested Prodigy. The world of PC enthusiasts love it, and I love it. It's damn near perfect and smartly designed. Very little space is wasted and it's very modifiable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fiebelkorn

customer_reviews.title: Great, but lose the handles
customer_reviews.text: Take the stupid handles off though and put on some standard rubber feet. The handles add unnecessary inches to the total dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: LAM

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and plenty of space for cable management
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my sister. She loves it. Easy install and plenty of space for cable management. Only complaint is that the top bars seem flimsy and I would never pick it up with those handles... just beware. Other than that great product.
customer_reviews.author: Azi

customer_reviews.title: A bit bulky for a MiniITX but it look good!. I got an i7 with an intel ...
customer_reviews.text: A bit bulky for a MiniITX but it look good!. I got an i7 with an intel Water cooler 2 HDD, 1SSD and 1 BluRay, with an R9280X, every fit fine with a decent temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Wilfredo Perdomo

customer_reviews.title: Fairly bad even for a cheap case.
customer_reviews.text: Its handles/legs are suitable for neither purpose. They are so flimsy that the case wobbles under its own weight as they bend. They are too sharp-edged to use as handles, which is probably for the best; they also flex enough when lifted that they seem likely to break within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: No

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case, easy to clear it out to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful case, easy to clear it out to make room for liquid cooling and a 980GTX Ti. Not sure if I'm able to link external links but here is my build on PCPartPicker: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Zenon

customer_reviews.title: Flawed but decent
customer_reviews.text: It's a good case, attractive and mostly well built. Only mostly well built because the case wiring on mine is faulty, forcing me to turn the reset button into the power button (and just do without on the reset). It's survivable but annoying. Still, it doesn't seem like a common complaint with the Prodigy so I would probably still recommend the case to others.
customer_reviews.author: Crimean

customer_reviews.title: Great for venting.
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to build into and has room for a LOT of fans.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great Case! Worth It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Case! I used it for my first build and it's absolutely wonderful. It arrived on time and was well worth the money (about $104 at the time). Overall a very versatile and roomy case for a Mini ITX.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Moraes

customer_reviews.title: looks good and fits most of what i need wish the ...
customer_reviews.text: looks good and fits most of what i need wish the build was better i would have gladly paid more money for a all metal case but otherwise this is the best case ive used
customer_reviews.author: J. Rouach

customer_reviews.title: great design, fits lots of HDs if needed ...
customer_reviews.text: Logo is glued on crooked. 230mm BitFenix fan that is supposed to fit in this case pushes against side panel leads and pin-header terminal plastic. Overall, great design, fits lots of HDs and with room to spare for custom watercool. Could use another centimeter between 3.5 in. HD cage and power supply housing.
customer_reviews.author: Ar

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing case design
customer_reviews.text: An Amazing case design. Cannot say anything bad about it so far, Other than the micro atx version of this case, terrible, terrible, design. But this case works Great.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Very good case, plenty of expansion room
customer_reviews.text: Very good case, plenty of expansion room. Ample room for multiple HDDs and efficient cooling. Easy to transport. The only thing I do not like is, the handles are made of a soft plastic material, I do not recommend carrying the case by the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Ashmen

customer_reviews.title: Every other feature and build quality are excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Handles and feet are wobbly, but strong. Every other feature and build quality are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Dariush Bakhtiari

customer_reviews.title: A nice case
customer_reviews.text: This case was larger than I had expected, but it is built well and has descent placement and lots of features for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 7 months till the bottom pieces that held ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 7 months till the bottom pieces that held the whole case off the floor came right off from the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Nexus

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful case.
customer_reviews.text: The handles are quite flexible, which surprised me, but the case is well built. It has fantastic airflow and plenty of room, especially for a mini-ITX case.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, but very little room for cable management
customer_reviews.text: Very happy, but very little room for cable management, otherwise great quality, and if your a fan of non-flimsy construction, this is good, its solid as a rock, at least the side panels are
customer_reviews.author: LMain

customer_reviews.title: Good case.  A littler larger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Plastic parts felt a little flimsy, but overall this has held up well. Very easy to install all the components, and it looks great. If I could give 4.5 stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: TB624

customer_reviews.title: Great Case
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, looks great, plenty of space for my build. Case is definitely on the bigger end for mini-ITX, but I prefer the extra space inside.
customer_reviews.author: Justanotheramazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Mostly awesome
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that the plastic on the bottom is not sturdy, and it causes the machine to wobble. It is made very well other than that. Building in it was a dream. That's right I said it, a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case as expected
customer_reviews.text: This was the only place that would ship this case without having to wait 4 weeks for the case to be shipped. Excellent case as expected, wish the handles were metal and not plastic because after putting a lot of weight in it the handles bend and just feel like they should be sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Whalen

customer_reviews.title: it's a solid case and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: This was the case of the first computer I put together from scratch. It's cramped inside, but everything fit. it's a solid case and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: uronoros

customer_reviews.title: Love a red computer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for grandson for Christmas. He was very pleased with the looks of it. Received very quickly & ordering was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Grand4.5

customer_reviews.title: Looks amazing. But big.
customer_reviews.text: You can fit a lot in this case. Its way bigger than i thought it was. Wish i got something slightly smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Jac11

customer_reviews.title: Great Case!
customer_reviews.text: Some of the older reviews mention trouble with the power supply and the back plate. Well it appears that BitFenix listened because my case had a large cut out were the two 2.5 SSD mounting spots should have been.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron McClure
